algorithm_technique: Group access times by employee. For each employee, sort their access times and use a sliding window to check for three or more within an hour.
problem_summary_simple: Identify workers who used their keycard 3+ times within any one-hour window.
problem_summary_technical: Use a hashmap to store times per employee. Sort times and apply a sliding window of size 3 to detect violations.
key_insights: Convert time strings to a numerical representation (minutes since midnight) for easier comparison.
A hashmap is ideal for grouping access times by employee.
Sorting the times for each employee and then using a sliding window (or two pointers) is efficient for checking the one-hour constraint.
